description: Borrowed from Latin cartilāginōsus (“full of cartilage, very gristly”), from cartilāgō (“cartilage, gristle”) +‎ -ōsus (“-ous, -ose”); compare French cartilagineux. Equivalent to cartilage +‎ -ous, with modifications made to its morphology.

adjectives.description: cartilaginous (comparative more cartilaginous, superlative most cartilaginous)

definitionGroups.group: (anatomy) Comprising soft cartilage rather than bone.

entries.meaning: (zoology, of a vertebrate animal) Having a skeleton of cartilage.
examples: Cartilaginous fish such as the angler fish have a skeletal structure made up of cartilage.

entries.meaning: (mycology) Having a tough or fibrous texture, usually in reference to a mushroom stipe.
